translator.minionModel
Class MinionBoolVariable

java.lang.Object
  translator.minionModel.MinionIdentifier
      translator.minionModel.MinionBoolVariable

public final class MinionBoolVariable
extends MinionIdentifier

Notes on indices: Single boolean variables have the same relative index as absolute index (since boolean variables are the first ones on Minion models). But boolean variables that are collected in vectors or matrices have a different relative and absolute index.

Author:
andrea, ian

Method Detail

setIndices

protected void setIndices(int relIndex,
                          int absIndex)
Sets the Minion model indicies. This method should only be called in the MinionModel.

Parameters:
relIndex - the relative (integer) index value of the boolean Minion variable
absIndex - the absolute (integer) index value of the boolean Minion variable

setPolarity

public void setPolarity(int p)
The polarity is only relevant for cases where negation has been applied. We can only consider this case DIRECTLY in the MinionConstraints. So if a variable is negated, then its polarity is set to false. The variable is checked for a negative polarity in the Minion Constraint, and reset to true, if it was false.

Overrides:
setPolarity in class MinionIdentifier
Parameters:
p -

toString

public String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
the String representing the boolean Minion variable. Usually "x" followed by its index, for instance "x4" (with index 4).
